inn1.comm: full in length on the off stump line, pushed out to the off side
curves in on the middle and leg stump line, gets past the defensive prod to strike high on the pad
straightening on the off stump line, punched away to the off side.
around the off stump, angling away, he stands tall to punch it to mid-off
first runs as Vermeulen steals a single after pushing towards mid-on. If there was a direct hit, he would have been run out
good nagging line and length continues. On the middle stump line, defended to the off side
in the zone outside off stump, moving away gently, left alone
lovely looking punchy drive through cover point. He stood tall and drove on the up. Very neatly done.
tries to work across the line, misses and gets a leg bye

Wow! what a delivery. Don't blame Sibanda for edging it. It curved away late from a good length and clipped the outer edge as Sibanda pushed at it;  he had to play at it. It did just enough to get the edge. There is no use getting dramatic big movement and missing the bat. Perfect delivery.

this one holds its line, bounces in towards middle stump, evades the bat and hits the pad. The ball rolls behind and they steal a single. Rahim, the hyper-active keeper, pounces on the ball and fires in a direct at the non-striker's end but he is just home.

Meanwhile, Vermeulen continues to look good. Another flashy on-the-up drive. Again, he stood up tall, got on top of the bounce of the short-of-length delivery before punching it neatly through cover point
allows the ball to come to him before guiding it to third man for a single
straightening on the middle, punched to mid-on
turns this length delivery to backward point
doesn't quite move forward but just leans forward a touch to push the length delivery to mid-off
walks a couple of steps out and tries to drive but ends up edging it past the first slip and down to third man
length delivery angling away from the off stump, he mistimes the drive to short cover
leans forward to defend a length delivery
straightening on the stumps, tapped away gently
slips towards middle and leg, worked to long-leg for a single
slightly short in length and outside off stump, Masakadza cuts it through backward point region. He was on the front foot, opened the bat-face and punched it away
down the leg side, looks to flick but can't connect
What a soft dismissal. Vermeulen, who was looking so good, is gone. It was full and slipping to the legs, it could have been on driven anywhere but Vermeulen flicked it straight to short midwicket.
length delivery on the off stump line, punched to short cover. The keeper is standing up to the stumps
short in length, on the leg and middle stump line, very well played actually. He used the bottom-hand well as he let the top hand go limp and wristed the ball superbly past square leg
moving in to the right-hand batsmen, nudged away to the on side
slightly slower, floated across full around off stump, guided to backward point region for a single
high bouncer just outside leg stump line, left alone. Good thought, wrong execution.
drifts to the pads, short in length, Coventry shuffles across to clip it to fine-leg boundary. Easily done.
corrects his line - on the off stump line, defended to the off side
moves forward to turn the full delivery to short midwicket
short in length and moving towards leg and middle, clipped past square leg for a single
No violence. Pure timing. It was full pitched on the middle and leg line, Coventry allowed it to come to him before on driving it through wide mid-on region.
moving down the leg side and yes, it would be a wide
on the middle, tilting towards middle and leg, flicked away off the hips for a single
on the middle stump line, nurdled away to square leg for another single
back of length, straightening around the off stump, gets behind the line to defend very carefully, head over the ball, to the off side
stands up tall to punch the back-of-length delivery through covers for couple of runs
length delivery moving towards middle stump after landing around the leg stump line, pushed away to mid-on
slightly short in length, on the middle stump line, swatted away to  midwicket
fuller length, he was almost late in picking the length but adjusted in the end to get the bat ahead of the pad to defend
a touch short in length, angling away, Masakadza rocks on the back foot to punch it to covers
lands on the leg stump line, slightly slower in pace, moves towards middle, turned to short midwicket
length delivery around the off stump, leans forward to defend to the off side of the pitch
just outside off stump, guided to backward point
on the middle stump line, nudged to the on side
back of length around the off stump, pushed away to covers
bouncing outside the off stump, Coventry tries to dab it to third man but fails to connect. He then suggests he should have pulled it
short delivery, lifting outside off stump, Coventry tries to upper cut it over point but can't connect
length delivery on the middle stump line, defended to the on side
leans well forward to defend to the off side

moved outside leg stump and punched a length delivery on the middle and leg stump straight down the ground and past the bowler. He did move outside the leg stump but it never looked like a risk. He was not intending to slog, just punched through the line
pushed towards mid-off for a quick single
slower one, full and on the leg stump line, nudged to the on side
another off cutter, this time around the off stump, pushed back to the bowler
short and rising delivery outside off stump, Masakadza gets on the back foot to carve it stylishly over point.
Imperious shot! Coventry pulls off a stunner. It was another shortish delivery, Coventry went back to punch it in the air but well to the left of the mid-off.
OMG! What a flamboyant shot! It was short in length again, Coventry rocked back and forced it on the up and somehow managed it to send it all the way over long-off. Delicious hit.
fuller, slower one, defended to the on side of the pitch
back of length around off stump, guided down to third man
fullish, moving in from the off stump line, is late in picking the length and hence, late in getting forward but ends up jabbing it bat and pad,. Mahbubul shouts for lbw but turned down
drifting on the leg stump line, turned to square leg for a single
floated in on the leg stump line, hit on pad, trying to work it to the on side

And again. Masakadza is in trouble here. He is not using his wrists while trying to turn it to the on side. Firm hands and he is pushing too hard. Careful boy or else Shakib will swallow you with an arm-ball!
leans forward to nudge it to the on side
connects this time and gets a single
flighted on the off stump line, defended on the front foot
flighted full on the middle stump line, on driven for a single

What a mess. What terrible misunderstanding between the two. It was flicked past square leg and the fielder (Mehrab) ran in from deep square leg. Clearly they had to stop at a single as they never seemed sure of the second. But they turned for the second run, hesitated mid-way, tried to carry on forward but too late folks. The throw was accurate and Rahim whips off the bails in glee. Gone!
drifts in before turning, gets forward to defend back to the bowler
drags this shorter and that is easily put away to long-on
on the off and middle stump line, pushed away to the off side
turns on the leg stump line, misses the bat to strike the pad
loops this up, bit more air, on the off stump line, defended on the the front foot
goes for the arm-ball, quicker, hurries through but the batsman was alert and pushes it to the on side for a single
drifts in towards middle, turns, defended on the front foot
slightly short, on the off stump line, pushed away to the off side
gets forward to defend a flighted delivery.
slightly short, driven off the back-foot to deep cover
again punched away off the back-foot, this time down to long-off for a single
quicker delivery, Taylor quickly picks up the length and defends it down the track
worked away towards square leg, no room for a single there
flat delivery outside the off stump, Taylor goes back and taps it away on the off side
fuller length delivery, Taylor moves across and drives it down to long-on for a single
full and close to the off stump line, Taylor gets a good stride in and defends it with a straight bat
goes for the drive and is beaten by the turn, ball clips the outside edge and balloons over the cover fielders
worked away behind the stumps on the leg side, quick single
comes down the track and drives it straight back to the bowler
slightly short and Shakib pulls it back a bit, Masakadza is sucked in to the drive and he ends up with a thick outside edge to short third man
jumble of bat and pad and the ball rolls away on the leg side
gets right  behind the line and drives it down to long-on for an easy single
flat delivery outside the off stump, was in the slot and Masakadza drives it down to long-off. Good placement
looks to work it away on the leg side but fails to make contact
driven down to mid-off, the fielder is at the edge of the circle and they scamper through for a single
driven away on the leg side, straight to the fielder at short midwicket
short and the ball stayed low after hitting the deck, Masakadza goes back and is caught on the wrong foot but somehow manages to punch it down to long-on
driven straight back and Shakib fails to stop it cleanly
played across the spin but does well to work it away towards the vacant square leg region
Max! dances down the track, gets to the pitch of the delivery and lofts it over the long-on fence. Good clean hit
driven away on the leg side for an easy single

full and on the stumps, Taylor works it away behind the stumps on the leg side and they scamper through for a single, shy at the bowler's end hits the stumps and the ball races away to the long-on fence
defended stretching well forward
full and on the stumps, Taylor pushes forward and drives it down to long-on
short delivery outside the off stump, Masakadza leans back and forces it away to deep cover
good looking drive but the ball goes straight to the fielder at cover
driven wide of the fielder at cover, the first run is taken quickly and they scamper through for the second
defended on the front-foot
fuller length delivery and that's driven down to long-off for a single
punched down to long-on, easy single
worked away on the leg side
forced away down the track and past the bowler to the long-on region
worked away with the turn to the square leg region
driven wide of the fielder at cover, yet another easy single added to the total
turned away with the spin to the square leg region and once again the batsmen cross over comfortably
flat delivery, Taylor gets inside the line and drives it down to long-on
another full delivery on the pads and Masakadza drives it down to long-on
Talyor too drives the ball down to long-on
short delivery, Masakadza goes back and cuts it away to deep cover
tossed up in the slot outside the off stump and Taylor nicely drives it away through extra cover
another good looking drive through extra cover
pushes this delivery on the middle and off line to the off side
slower, loopy delivery outside off, guided to backward point
full on the middle, paddle swept to fine-leg regio n
shuffles across a touch and on drives to long-on
plays the sweep to pick up another single
quicker, flatter, just outside off, defended to short cover
swing and a miss. It was flighted delivery, luring the batsman into a big hit but it turned away and Rahim did well to collect it
reaches the pitch this time and drives to long-off
moves forward to ping long-on
full and on the middle and off line, squeezed to point region
leans forward to drive a flighted delivery to long-off for yet another single
tries to clip it to on side but it turns and he gets a leading edge back to the bowler
leans forward to defend to the off side
Nice. He punched the short-of-length delivery slightly wide of long-off and slowly enough to turn for the second run
And again. Very nicely done. Rahim was screaming at the fielder to rush in quickly but the second run couldn't be prevented
low dipping full toss, pushed past the bowler for a single
fuller, a tad quicker, pushed towards non-striker and the bowler gets across quickly to cut it off
slides towards middle and off, gets on the back foot to punch it past the non-striker for a single
flighted full on the middle stump line, driven back to the bowler
shapes to paddle a full toss but top edges it over the keeper for a single
a touch quicker, flatter definitely, turns away from the off stump, runs off the edge to short third man
slower, turning from the middle and off, defended to the off side
fuller, a touch wider outside off,driven to right of cover where a diving half- stop is done
turns it to fine-leg for a single
flighted full on the middle stump line, driven with the turn to long-off
shuffles across, tries to turn to the on side and is rapped on the pad. Huge shout for lbw. turned down. Close call. He had shuffled across and was hit on the middle stump line. Hmmmm
leans forward to nudge the full delivery to the on side
slower in the air, bit more air, driven to long-off
slightly short, slower in the air, though and that upsets the timing but he will pick up a single to long-on
on the middle and off, pushed towards short extra cover for a single
stretches forward to defend a flighted delivery
fuller, on the off stump line, on driven to long-on
from wide of the crease, drifts in towards off and middle before it spins past the intended drive and Rahim collects
from very wide of the crease again, driven back to the bowler
drifts towards leg stump, swept to fine-leg region for couple of runs and what's more that his 13th ODI fifty. Very fine innings so far. Can he carry on for a big one?
slightly short, goes back to cut it to sweeper cover
leans forward to push to covers
flighted just outside off stump, goes for the sweep, misses and is struck on the pad just outside line of off stump
chooses to go in the V this time and picks up a single with a drive to long-on
tickles this to square leg for a single
waits for the ball to turn before pushing it to cover point for a single
quicker one, hurries on to the batsman who does well to punch it away for a single
short delivery, could have been pulled but he pushes it to short midwicket
punches this one to long-on for a single
tries to pull, but is cramped up and is hit on the pad
another short delivery, pulled just over the backward square-leg fielder. Mahmudullah has been guilty of bowling short this over
threads this one through point region
streches forward to on drive to long-on
flighted on the off stump line, driven to long-off for a single. Long-off and long-on have been very productive areas for these two
slightly short, cut away to deep point
shuffles across, the bowler slows up the pace, nudged to square leg for a single
again a touch short, another cut to deep point
fuller, on the middle stump, not much turn, clipped to backward square-leg for a single
stays on the leg stump, on the back foot,  adjacent to the line and punches another back-of-length delivery sweetly to right of deep cover fielder. Very nicely done.
Whack! Another short delivery and Masakadza rocks back to wallop it over square leg.
finally, he hits the fuller length and the ball turns in to hit the bat and pad
flighted full and Masakadza drives to left of long-off for a single. They thought about the second run but killed the thought
shuffles right across to tap to cover
flighted full on the off stump line ,tickled to square leg
low full toss, mistimes the drives down the wicket and the bowler dives to his right to deflect it to short midwicket fielder
leans forward to drive to long-off
another shuffle- it has been a feature of his batting against spinners- and turns it to the vacant leg side for a single
There was no one in the circle on the leg side and the trick almost worked. Masakadza tried to swing it to the on side but gets a leading edge but it carries safely over cover
moves across to the off side to ping the on side for a single
slightly short and its cut to deep point
slow through the air, on the middle stump on a length, turns but it's paddled to fine-leg
turned just to the right of short midwicket and they rush across for a quick single
fuller, on the off and middle line, tapped to point
another paddle sweep from Masakadza, another single
leans forward to defend to the on side
goes back to punch a back-of-length delivery from the off stump line to long-on.
short in length, pushed towards long-off and they run the first run hard, think about the second but decide against it. And it's Taylor's fifty. Well played sir. Good partnership going on.
a touch short, cut to point where there is a fumble and they get across for a run
skids on towards middle and leg, turned to short midwicket
on the off stump line, pushed straight to cover
fuller, bit more air, driven to long-off for a single
quicker but shorter in length, again punched away to long-off
flighted full on the off stump line, driven to sweeper cover
shout for lbw as Taylor is caught on the shuffle. Perhaps missing off.
full and on the off stump, very full, on driven to long-on
slower, turns from the off stump, runs off the edge to short third man
fetches it from outside off stump and sweeps it hard to deep square leg region and he will pick up three valuable runs
full and just outside off, nudged towards short cover
short of length delivery outside off, Masakadza is too early into the cut and edges it down the track
guided to third man region for a single
on the off stump line, guided down to third man again
Wallop! He biffed that. It was another short-of-length delivery on the off stump line and Masakadza pulled it high over midwicket boundary. It's his highest ODI score
rocks back to cut it to through point region
waits for the slightly slower delivery to arrive before gliding it to third man
flighted on the middle and leg, drifts in to hit the pad
goes for his favourite paddle sweep and gets couple of runs
And again. This time he will get just a single, though.
on the leg and middle line, nudged close to the on side and he sets off for a single but Rahim is quicker, hares across, swoops on the ball and Taylor rushes back to get to his crease
leans forward to defend to the on side
flighted full outside off stump, eased to sweeper cover
yorker length delivery, super start, jabbed away to the off side
But he drifts to the leg side this time, not used by the batsman who just swats it to short fine-leg fielder
goes for the yorker, ends up short of the blockhole, driven down to long-on
full pitched on the middle and leg stump line, swung to deep square leg
again drifts outside leg, again, the batsman fails to put it away, just turned straight to short fine-leg fielder
above waist-high full toss, swung to right of long-on region. No-ball not called, that height looked dicey..
moves outside leg and tries to go inside-out over extra cover but doesn't get the placement right and instead, pings long-off
slightly short and cut away to deep point region
Dropped by Raqibul. What a shocker. It was a dolly, a sitter but he has spilled it. Again, Taylor had tried to go inside-out but ended up slicing it straight to Raqibul at long-off. What a clanger.
plays the paddle sweep for a single
leans forward to drive through the on side
a touch short, cuts but can't beat cover
on the hips, tries to tickle it away to the on side but ends up edging it down the track
Rasel keeps dangerously flirting with his outside-leg deliveries, again the batsman misses out, hit straight to short fine-leg. Masakadza on strike. He has never hit a 100 before in ODIs

He does it. His first ever ODI hundred. He looks up to the skies after turning this ball to square leg. What a fine knock this has been. The small crowd cheer, the  players in the dressing room applaud
crashes this one to right of deep cover and they run very hard to come back for the third run.
clears the front foot and swings it to the cowcorner, the long-on fielder rushes across to his right to cut it off

Rasel cleans him up with a slower one. His special- the off cutter. Masakadza shaped for the big slog across the line but was beaten by the lack of pace. Fine innings comes to an end. A very good partnership with Taylor.
on the pads, turned to fine-leg region for couple of runs
steps down the track, the bowler cleverly slows up the pace, and its cut to point. The non-striker rushes for a single but is sent back and he makes it back in time
just outside off, Taylor squeezes it to short third man and this time he wants a run! Sent back in time.
floated full on the off and middle stump line, hit on the pad , trying to sweep
A very fine skillful shot there. He backed away a touch, adjusted the quickish delivery and played a deft late-cut well to the left of short third-man fielder
starts with a length delivery outside off, squeezed to backward point
fullish, swings away a touch, guided through backward point region
Shot! Slightly short in length and outside off, Chigumbura waited for it on the front foot and cut it superbly through point region
full, very full outside off, squeezes under the bat and rushes through to the keeper
just short of the blockhole, and it's pushed towards long-off and they rush across for the second run
full pitched delivery, driven hard down the wicket, deflected by the bowler
on the middle and leg, swept away for a single
fuller, on the middle stump line, pushed down to long-on
That Zim commentator who has a booming voice has gone berserk as Chigumbura thrashes a flighted delivery flat over long-on for a big six!
rotates the strike now with a sweep shot
dropped by Rahim. Tough chance. It was delivered from wide of the crease and pushed through quicker. It turns from the off stump, gets the edge but Rahim can't hold on
leans forward to defend to the off side
short and outside off stump delivery, a bouncer, left alone. He perhaps was hoping for a wide.
Full pitched delivery on the middle and Chigumbura, who is beginning to play a delightfully brave little innings, lifts it straight over the bowler's head
Thrash! It was overpitched outside off stump and Chigumbura flays it to wide long-off boundary. No chance for the long-off fielder to get across in time
goes for the short-pitched delivery, misses the pull and the ball bounds off the body to the off side
slightly slower one, full in length, clipped to deep backward square-leg region and the short fine-leg fielder rushes after the ball
bangs it in short, doesn't connect well with the pull and drags the ball down to long-on
leans forward to square drive to point for a single
sweeps from the stumps and will come back easily for the second run

Taylor unfurls a beauty! One-handed six over extra cover! He charged down the track, was beaten in flight actually, reaches out, takes the bottom-hand off the handle and goes through with the shot. Very well adjusted. And it kept flying.
pushes it to point for a single
skids on to the middle, defended back down the track
skips down the track and mistimes the slog sweep but will pick up two runs
moves outside leg, Rasel follows him with a full delivery, hit down to long-on
Rasel fires in the bouncer, intelligent stuff, and Chigumbura fails to connect with the pull
Aha! Rasel now slips in the slower one and Chigumbura, on the charge, can't put wood on leather again. The slower bouncer.
full delivery, Chigumbura goes for the almighty slog over midwicket and doesn't connect. The ball goes between him and the leg stump and Rahim makes a diving stop. Taylor walks across to have a chat
Rasel continues to impress. Another slow off cutter outside off, a big swing and a miss. Oh it has been called a wide. Border line call i guess
Chigumbura makes contact finally and boy, it keeps sailing. Six over midwicket. It was the bouncer and he played a feisty pull shot.
Chigoomboooraaaaaa! It was the slow bouncer from Rasel and Chigumbura, who was fooled by one such delivery earlier in this over, picked this one early, waited before clubbing it over cowcorner
on the off stump line, turned through the vacant on side and by the time the man comes in from the deep, they take two very easily
waits for the ball to turn before tapping it to the left of short third-man fielder
backs away to drive to long-off
quicker one, skids on to the middle, turned past square leg
on the middle stump line, skidding on quickly,driven back to the bowler

50 up for Chigumbura. In some style. What a lovely cameo this has been. Shakib slowed up the pace, gave bit more air, Chigumbura was ready, waited for it to arrive, cleared the front foot and biffed it handsomely high over long-on
fullish, on the middle, tries to clip it to the on side and hand the strike to Chigumbura but gets a leading edge back to the bowler
moves outside leg a touch, deflects the full delivery to midwicket and gets the single that he was looking for.
low dipping full toss on the middle, hit to left of long-on but he can't come back for the second run

What a delicious little late cut from Taylor. Fab shot this. It was the slow off cutter, on the stumps, Taylor waited for it, allowed it to pass him before opening the bat-face and deftly placing it between keeper and short third-man.
hands the strike back to Chigumbura with a push drive
Wallop!  Low full toss outside off stump and Chigumbura flays it hard and flat over long-off. Boom boom!
leans forward to tap the flighted slow delivery to the on side of the pitch

Taylor is run out, going for the second run. It was pushed towards long-off and Chigumbura pushed for the second run. Taylor rushed across and even tried to dive into the crease but the throw  was accurate and fast and Rahim did the rest.  A very fine knock from Taylor comes to an end.
skips down the track and is beaten in the flight by Shakib but he adjusts to stretch out to push the ball to extra cover
drags this one to long-on for a single
goes right back to push the quicker one to the on side for a single
skips down the track and forces it to deep midwicket region. Fine over from the wonderful Shakib
backs away, the bowler pushes it outside off stump, slashed away but straight to sweeper cover
Matsikenyeri does his bit. He picked the slower one early and whacked it over long-off boundary. Good clean swing of the bat.
carves this one through covers for couple of runs
full pitched outside off, Matsi leans across to square drive it through point region. He picked the gap well and depended on timing to get the ball away
he chooses violence this time. He leans across to get to the pitch of the full delivery well outside off and thrashes it through covers. They run very hard to come back for the fourth run!
The rattled bowler slips this one wide outside off stump. 312 for 5. How much more they can get on this batting beauty?
Full again, closer to the off stump, sliced away to sweeper cover. Final over coming up.

The white ball is flying everywhere. Matsikenyeri sashays down the track, doesn't quite reach the pitch of the ball but boy, does he go through with the shot or what? He flayed it high and over long-on
And he is gone now. He tries to slog sweep from outside off stump but gets a leading edge and presents a dolly to short third-man fielder. Handy little innings, though.
on the middle stump, pulled high in the air and it falls between deep midwicket and long-on
Shakib gets one more wicket. Another slog sweep attempted, another edge, and it's caught at midwicket
And Zimbabwe finish on 323 for 7, their highest score against Bangladesh

inn2.comm: Mupariwa has struck gold first ball. It was a lovely curving delivery around the off stump, Tamim stabbed it, without moving his feet,  straight to first slip. Mupariwa celebrates as if he is rocking a baby. Memories of Bebeto, Romario from the World Cup football. Here we go. What a start.
Cracker of a cover drive. He leaned into the shot and caressed the ball through the off side.
length delivery just outside off stump and Ashraful pushes it to cover
straighter, straightening on the middle stump, Ashraful is a touch late in getting the bat in front of the pad but eventually does so and keeps the ball out
in the channel outside off stump, left alone by Ashraful. Good teasing delivery, that.
in the zone again, left alone again. 4 for 1 in the first over.
climbs from short of length, goes on the back foot to defend it to the off side
strays to the legs and Naeem sends it over square leg region. A flick of the wrist and he swatted it up and over

Two down now! What a start for Zimbabwe. Naeem, the pinch hitter, backed outside leg stump and went for the good-old slog - he pulled off similar shots in the first ODI - but missed it completely. The stump has gone for a walk.
hmmm ... it was slightly wide outside off and Raqibul plays a risky aerial shot over covers. He was not in control as he had to really stretch far across
much better this time as he gets right behind the line to defend to the off side
length delivery homing in on the off stump, nudged away to cover
full pitched around the off stump, driven to mid-off
around the off stump line, perhaps just outside, holding its line, guided to backward point. Ashraful then suggests that he should have left it go
tilts in towards middle and leg, flicked past square leg for couple of runs
just outside off stump, bouncing off the good length, Ashraful tries to play a punchy stroke to cover point but mistimes it and the ball rolls away to the off side
Connects well this time but can't beat backward point.
in the channel outside off stump, straightening out and Ashraful allows the ball to pass him
drifts to the pads and its flicked to deep square-leg for a single

again drifting to the middle and leg, flicked to right of Mupariwa at deep square leg, they turn for the second, could have been risky but the throw was way above the stumps and by the time the keeper pulled it down to the ground, Ashraful was home
leans forward to defend a length delivery on the off stump line
short in length and that allows Ashraful to wrist it past square leg
a touch slower, on the middle and leg, turned to midwicket.
on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket

Ashraful combusts spectacularly. He ran down the wicket and tried to slash it over covers but the ball flew off the outside edge straight down to third man. Three down and the Bangladesh boat is rocking. And so is Mupariwa.
full pitched on the middle and leg, turned to the on side
slightly short in length, cut away to third man for a single
lovely nip-backer that cuts Raqibul into half - well metaphorically ie !- and the ball rushes past the off stump and the keeper makes a fumble
leans forward to push a length delivery to mid-off. Mupariwa has been very impressive so far. Nagging line and length and just enough movement to keep the batsmen wary.
Oh boy the comms curse works brilliantly! He strays down the leg side and Shakib, in wonderful form these days, doesn't miss out. He swats it over to deep backward square-leg boundary
short in length, Raqibul hops back to defend it to the on side
goes back again and this time, clips the ball to square-leg for a single
angling away from Shakib who goes for an inside-out drive but mistimes it to mid-off
pushes it wide outside off and the umpire extends his arms
length delivery bouncing on the middle stump line, pushed away to mid-on

Oh .. What a big swing and a miss. It was full and just outside off stump, Shakib, worried about the run rate and wanting to counterattack, went for a huge swing across the line but missed it completely
slower one on the middle and leg line, nudged to the on side
back of length on the off stump line, pushed to cover point

run out chance! missed. It was turned to short fine-leg fielder who had a shy at the non-striker's end but couldn't hit the sticks. Had the throw found its mark.. Mupariwa would have been rocking his baby
lunges forward to play a pick-up stroke over midwicket. It was full pitched delivery on the leg stump line
slightly short and Shakib goes for the pull but doesn't time it well but the ball lands safely behind square leg
Another wild swing, another miss and the ball thuds into the pad but missing leg stump...
bangs it in short and Shakib pulls weakly down to deep square leg
wild wayward delivery outside off stump ... wide
almost caught and bowled. It bounced more than Shakib anticipated and he shoveled it just past the lunging bowler
worked down to third man for a single
Thwack! It was short in length and Shakib, who has been trying hard to go for his pulls and swings to the leg side for some time now, connects very well this time.

But not this time. Another across-the-line swing attempted but unlike previous delivery, he had to fetch it from outside-off and only succeeded in spooning a dolly to backward point. Huge huge blow this. Shakib, the man in form, departs.
fullish delivery on the middle stump, driven to mid-off
climbs from short of length, outside off, Rahim drops his wrists and gets the bat out of the way
full in length, just outside off stump, driven to mid-off.
just outside off stump, a length delivery that straightens, pushed past non-striker for a single
leans forward to defend to the off side
in the zone outside off stump, left alone
short and wide, slapped to the point boundary. Rahim, as is his wont, played that cut shot on the front foot
stretches forward to push to covers
throat-high bouncer and Raqibul pulls it down well to deep square leg fielder. There is a man there, waiting for a mistake, but Raqibul pulled this one to the ground
fuller, just outside off stump, the slower one, driven to left of mid-off
short in length, holding its line outside off and that length allows Rahim to open the bat-face and steer it to left of backward point
Dropped by Utseya. Short and wide, cut  in the air and Utseya dives to his left  at cover point but couldn't hold on. Tough chance and he tried hard but ..
lifting delivery surprises Rahim who fends it away towards third man
hangs back to turn this to third man for a single
full pitched outside off and there is some width as well, Raqibul tries to thrash it through the off side but mistimes it towards mid-off
the slower one arrives, driven to the on side for a single
length delivery shaping away a touch from outside off, guided to backward point
Another slower one, loopy delivery dipping in front of the middle stump, carefully defended to the on side
length delivery on the off stump line, pushed towards mid-on for a run
good-length delivery on the middle stump line, tapped to the off side
slower delivery bouncing from short of length, chopped down to third man
full in length and moving in the corridor outside off, left alone
goes for the head-high bouncer and Rahim pulls it well to the right of deep square leg where Mupariwa does very well to rush across and make a diving stop
fuller, on the off stump line, pushed to extra cover for a single
tries to turn a length delivery from the middle stump to the on side but it straightens a touch to get a leading edge and the ball rolls away towards cover
wider outside off stump and Rahim goes for the big off-side shot but doesn't connect
gentle seam-up delivery on the middle and off, holding its line and the ball runs off the edge to third man. The keeper is standing up to the stumps
just outside off, misses the cut and Taylor does well to gather that
Thump! Rahim lunges forward, picks the length delivery from the off stump and swings it high and over midwicket boundary. He ended up on his back knee as he completed the hit
And so, Masakadza pushes this wider outside off and Rahim top-edges his cut, down to third man
Again well outside off stump, but he has pushed that a touch too far wide
full and outside off stump, driven sweetly but straight to cover
full again, driven to mid-off for a single.
on the middle and off, defended back down the pitch
on the off stump line, punched to sweeper cover
skips down the track, reaches the pitch and on drives to mid-on
on the middle and leg stump line, nudged to left of square leg for a single
turns from the middle and off line, runs off the edge to short third man
goes right back to defend to the on side. Good tight over. He bowled with the man in the circle at mid-on, tempting the batsmen to go for it ...
Huge gaps on the leg side and the batsmen are going after Masakadza. Again, fetched from just outside off and swung to deep square leg boundary
Afraid that he would be hit to the leg side, Masakadza pushes this wide outside off
on the middle stump line, pushed to the on side and midwicket fielder runs across to cut it off
on the middle and leg line, clipped to short fine-leg
slower one, on the middle, pushed to left of long-on
floated full outside off stump and Rahim waits for the slower one to arrive and clubs it over mid-off
on the off stump line, full, driven to sweeper cover
drags this shorter and pulled to deep midwicket
bowls a off break on the off stump line, turned to square leg
another short delivery, pulled down to long-on. Rahim would feel he missed out there
flighted full just outside off, defended on the front foot
moves forward to ease it down to long-on
rocks back to cut a delivery which wasn't all that short to deep backward point region
punched down to long-on for a single
defended on the front foot
worked away on the leg side, no room for a single there
tossed up and that's driven straight bat, Price moves across to his left and cuts off the single
turned away with the spin to the square leg region, again no room for a single - good over so far
short and this one turns in slow, Rahim stays back and punches it away well in front of point - easy single
slightly short and on the stumps, Rahim goes back and across and drives it away through cover
tossed up and turning in, worked away off the back-foot to the square leg region
fuller length delivery, Rahim gets forward to the pitch of the delivery and drives it down to long-on for a single
tries to work it away with the spin but fails to make contact and the ball rolls away off the pad
fulltoss on the stump, Hasan goes down on one knee and sweeps it away to deep square leg where it is not stopped cleanly and the ball rolls over the ropes
forced away behind square on the off side
moves down the track to play an off drive
flighted delivery on the middle and leg, goes right back to nudge it to square leg
a tad quicker but again on the middle and leg line, easily clipped to deep midwicket
tossed up full, doesn't connect well with the drive and the ball rolls away to the on side
backs away outside leg, Price slips in a quicker one, punched to the off side for a single
slower, turning into the middle stump line, turned to right of short midwicket, wants a single but the fielder is quicker
floated outside off, goes for the reverse sweep but hits straight to short third man
on the leg stump line, clipped to deep square leg region for couple of runs
turns into the middle stump from short of length, reverse swept to deep point region
from round the stumps now, stretches forward to defend a delivery turning in from outside off
flighted delivery on the off stump, turned to short midwicket
And again. the round-the-stumps angle is working better for Waller
slightly short, pulled away for a single
on the off stump line, eased down to long-off
Nice. Not only slower through the air but lots more flight as well,, defended to the off side. Good bowling this

Price gets a wicket for his fine bowling. Again, tossed up, loopy delivery luring Rahim down the track and he hit it straight down to long-on. Reward for some good bowling. Five down now and tottering ...
gets forward to defend to the on side
fuller, on the middle stump, takes care not the press the front leg across and drives down to long-on
from round the stumps, just outside off stump, steered through point for a single
slower, flighted on the off and middle, turned to the leg side
tossed up on the middle, swung to deep midwicket for a single
just outside off stump, guided through cover point for a single
lands it full outside off, driven down to long-off
a tad short, definitely a touch quicker, on the middle stump line, nudged past square leg
quicker delivery on the middle, punched to long-on for a single
shuffles outside leg and drives the flighted delivery to long-off
slows up the pace, gives it more air, Mahmudullah skips down the track and drives to left of long-off
a touch quicker, on the middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
continues to vary his pace. this one was slower, on the middle and off, defended down the track
full and on the off stump line, turning away, pushed to cover
turns in from the off stump, sharp turn there, and spins down the leg side past the attempted flick.
leans forward to drive Utseya to left of long-off
lands outside off, straightens a touch, cut down to short third man
turns the full delivery from outside off, with the turn, to short fine-leg
works this one to left of that short fine-leg fielder for a single
slightly short outside off stump, cut to deep point
quickish on the off and middle, very full, pushed back to Price
on the off stump, a touch slower, defended to the off side
moves outside leg, Price stays calm and bowls this on the middle, defended back to him
slows up the pace, bit more flighted , outside off, steered clear of backward point and they rush across to complete two runs
full and on the off and middle line, reverse swept to short third man where Vermeulen stops
from slightly wide of the crease, the quickish arm-ball, pulled away wide of long-on
plays the paddle shot and gets it well to the right of Price at short fine-leg
outside off stump, tries to sweep, ,misses and it bounds off the thigh of the keeper
gets forward to defend the off break to the off side
on the off stump line, turning in, flicked to deep backward square leg
outside off stump, skidding on, attempts the cut shot and is beaten
back to regular programming - he leans forward to play with the turn past square leg
Price takes out another. The wheels are coming off. It was another nice tempting loopy flighted delivery, he went down the track but ended up chipping it straight to long-off.
goes for the slightly quicker delivery but drifts down leg side, glanced away to fine-leg boundary
on the middle stump line, turning away, pushed down to long-on
flighted up outside off stump, tries to turn it to the on side but doesn't connect well and the ball bobs away to the on side
stretches across to work it to midwicket
spins from the off stump, past the prod and Taylor collects down leg
goes back to clip it to the on side for a single
Waller bowls a full toss, swept away
tosses it up on the off stump line, swung down to long-on
slower, around the off stump, slight turn, nudged to point
leans across to work a flighted delivery to midwicket
lands on the off stump, on a length, turns away, defended on the front foot
spins in from outside off, worked to midwicket
on the middle and leg line, full but he unfurls the reverse sweep and connects superbly to send the ball to deep backward point boundary
from round the stumps now, on the middle and off line, dabbed to the on side
Maximum! It was flighted on the leg and middle line, he went down on his right knee to dump it high over square-leg boundary. Very fine hit.
and gets off the strike now with a little dab shot to square-leg
slips down the leg side and Umpire Amesh Saheba says that's wide
just outside off, turning away, plays the late-cut and gets the ball past the short third-man fielder
leans well forward to ease this one to long-on
on the leg stump line and its swept to deep backward square-leg region
on the middle stump line, dabbed to the on side
flighted full, on driven to long-on for a single
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper cover
down the leg side, swept away to short fine-leg

Fierce thump! He went down on his right knee and swung a full length delivery into midwicket stands. Raqibul, who played a lovely cameo in the second Test on the tense final day against West Indies, is playing another fine knock here
he goes for another swing but ends up dragging it down to long-on
on the middle stump line, nudged to the on side
slower one, on the middle and leg, full, turned to deep square leg
full and well outside off stump, bordering on that wide line and yes, it's a wide
fullish, on the middle, driven to long-on
on the middle and leg, turned towards short fine-leg for a single
on the off stump line, steered to point
goes right back to turn the off break past square-leg
on the off stump line, dabbed towards backward point region for a single
slows up the pace and that upsets the rhythm of Raqibul who was looking to sweep and is hit on the body
a tad quicker, goes right back to clip it past square leg
on the middle and leg, turning with some bounce, stabbed to the on side

Masakadza ends Raqibul's superb resistance. It was full and straight, Raqibul tried to repeat the six from the earlier over as he went for another big swing towards midwicket  but couldn't get any wood on leather. Clatter!
full pitched around the off stump and it has been beautifully hit inside-out through extra cover. Very nicely timed.
just outside off stump, punched to cover
slower one, fullish on the leg stump line, misses the flick, runs off the pad to fine-leg region
pushes it across outside off stump, tries to squeeze it to point, misses and Taylor, standing up to the stumps, gathers it neatly
leans forward to defend a length delivery
goes back to push it past square leg
around the off stump, steered through point
leans forward to drive but can't beat cover
stays back to flick it past square leg
leans forward to push it to the on side of the pitch
outside off stump, shapes to cut but doesn't connect
outside off stump, shoveled through point region
outside off stump, stabbed to the off side
gets forward to ease it to long-off
flighted outside off, pushed to cover
moves back to turn it to square leg
slightly short, cut past point
comes down the track, the bowler drags back the length and he defends it down the track
homing in on the off stump, steered to point
gets the inside-edge on the intended punchy drive and the ball rolls to fine-leg
spins in towards the off stump, goes back to punch it to deep extra-cover region
on the leg stump line, swept to fine-leg region
spins in from outside off stump, defended on the front foot
slightly short outside off stump, cut to deep backward point
flighted on the off stump and Mahbubul swings it high and over wide long-on. Up up and over
Maximum again! He is indulging himself out there. It was flighted on the off stump line and he lunged out to drag it over midwicket boundary
Three in a row! Superb fun! Mahbubul goes for yet another big hit; this is the biggest of the three. The white ball sails into the long-on stands. Immense fun.
flighted outside off stump, turns in, pushed through cover point
down leg, misses the flick but would collect the wide
leans forward to defend to the off side
the quicker arm-ball on the middle, pushed back to the bowler
another quickish arm-ball, the batsman shapes to pull, gets a faint tickle to fine-leg as the ball rushes between him and the leg stump
stays back to drag this down to long-on for a single
moves down the track, Price shortens the length and he takes it on the pad while lunging forward to defend
bouncing from short of length outside off, pushed, well away from the body, to cover
leans forward to work this through the on side to deep square-leg region
back of length, lifting, again moves towards leg and plays well away from the body as he steers it to cover point
short in length on the off stump, moves towards the line to push it to cover point for a single
back of length around the off stump line, pushed to covers for what should have been a single but the throw is wild and they get some overthrows
short delivery, pushed down to point
just outside off, tries to cut but misses
full delivery outside off, swing and a miss
fulish, on the off stump line, mistimes the drive towards the bowler who fumbles
on the middle and off, pushed to the off side
leans forward to turn to midwicket
goes right back to work it to square leg
leans forward to punch on the up to extra cover
sharp bouncer on the off stump line, sways away from the line
Dropped at midwicket. It was pulled weakly just over midwicket and Utseya jumped but ended up palming it away
full and outside off, slashed away to deep backward point where masakdaza makes a fine diving stop
pushed to the on side for a quick single, Mahbubul and chigumbura collide, the bat drops to the ground as he tumbles but he recovers quickly to make to the crease
low full toss on the leg stump line, flicked to deep square leg for a single
floated full outside off stump, edges the intended drive; profitable edge as the ball races away past the short third-man fielder and runs away to the boundary
arm-ball just outside off, skidding on, gets past the cut and the keeper collects
And then they were two. Mehrab couldn't keep his drive down and Vermeulen swoops low at short extra-cover to pluck the catch.
full and well outside off stump, swing and a miss
low full toss on the middle, pushed down to long-on
Clobbered! Mahbubul has reached his fifty in no time! He thrashed this flighted delivery to the long-off boundary. He hit that really hard.
the slower one, full and on the middle, tickled to right of short midwicket
backs away to the leg side and hits a dipping full toss down to long-on
Another slower one, delivered with split fingers - between the middle finger and third finger - and the batsman went for a big hit but was too early into the shot
lunges forward to ping long-off
moves outside leg, the ball follows him and he defends to the off side
full pitched on the middle stump line, slammed past the bowler and long-off comes around to make the stop

Price cleans him up with the arm-ball. He was clueless as he went back and stabbed outside the line of the ball. The off stump was pegged back and Zimbabwe are just a wicket away from getting their first win of the series.
yorker length hit the boot but missing leg stump
flighted delivery, hit down to long-on
steps down the track and goes for a huge slog across the line, misses, but luckily, gets the edge and the ball races away to fine-leg boundary. Price holds his head.
delivers the arm-ball, goes for the pull and edges it to the pad
short in length and skidding on, pulled down to long-on
fullish outside off stump, another big swing attempted and the top edge takes the ball over backward point

Rock the baby Mupariwa! He produces another edge as the batsman goes for a similar slog and this time it settles down safely at backward point. Zimbabwe have won their first game of the series. Remember, Bangladesh have already won two. Game on now.
